4704.verse: فَأَقْبَلَتِ|Then came forward|148|163|16134$ٱمْرَأَتُهُۥ|his wife|98|128|16135$فِى|with|48|78|89$صَرَّةٍ|a loud voice,|105|135|16136$فَصَكَّتْ|and struck|92|122|16137$وَجْهَهَا|her face|84|99|16138$وَقَالَتْ|and she said,|108|201|2998$عَجُوزٌ|`An old woman|120|306|8614$عَقِيمٌ|barren!`|75|168|16139$

4683.verse: Indeed, you are in differing speech.

4684.verse: Deluded away from the Qur'an is he who is deluded.

4686.verse: Who are within a flood [of confusion] and heedless.

4687.verse: They ask, "When is the Day of Recompense?"

4688.verse: [It is] the Day they will be tormented over the Fire

4689.verse: [And will be told], "Taste your torment. This is that for which you were impatient."

4690.verse: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs,

4691.verse: Accepting what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good.

4692.verse: They used to sleep but little of the night,

4693.verse: And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness,

4694.verse: And from their properties was [given] the right of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived.

4695.verse: And on the earth are signs for the certain [in faith]

4696.verse: And in yourselves. Then will you not see?

4697.verse: And in the heaven is your provision and whatever you are promised.

4698.verse: Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth, indeed, it is truth - just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.

4699.verse: Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham? -

4700.verse: When they entered upon him and said, "[We greet you with] peace." He answered, "[And upon you] peace, [you are] a people unknown.

4701.verse: Then he went to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf

4702.verse: And placed it near them; he said, "Will you not eat?"

4703.verse: And he felt from them apprehension. They said, "Fear not," and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.

4704.verse: And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm] and struck her face and said, "[I am] a barren old woman!"

4705.verse: They said, "Thus has said your Lord; indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."
